Teaching assistanceships

MM220: Computation Lab

This course introduced undergrad students to basics of scientific computing using high level languages such as GNU Octave, Python, and MATLAB. This course was mandatory for all incoming undergrad students of the department. Class size would range between 150-160. My responsibilities as a teaching assistant included: (i) providing assistance to students in coding and debugging, (ii) evaluation of tutorials and quizes

MM656: Simulation and Optimisation

This was an elective course that dealt with classical optimisation techniques and linear programming. The course included some hands-on tutorial sessions and

MM745: Stengthening mechanisms in crystalline solids
